body: @tcNickolas could you try running the tests for this PR as well if you have time?
I completed a pass.

I ran again on a machine with 6 cores, and the tests all run. However, one fails:

```
Test Name:  Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Utility.TestDriverConfigGenerator.TestGeneratingDriverConfigFileWithoutNameServer
Test FullName:  Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Utility.TestDriverConfigGenerator.TestGeneratingDriverConfigFileWithoutNameServer
Test Source:    D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Utility\TestDriverConfigGenerator.cs : line 76
Test Outcome:   Failed
Test Duration:  0:00:00.11

Result StackTrace:  
at Org.Apache.REEF.Driver.Bridge.ClrClientHelper.ExtractConfigfileFromJar(String reefJar, IList`1 configFiles, String dropFolder) in D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Driver\Bridge\ClrClientHelper.cs:line 60
   at Org.Apache.REEF.Driver.DriverConfigGenerator.ExtractConfigFromJar(String jarfileFolder) in D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Driver\DriverConfigGenerator.cs:line 154
   at Org.Apache.REEF.Driver.DriverConfigGenerator.DriverConfigurationBuilder(DriverConfigurationSettings driverConfigurationSettings) in D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Driver\DriverConfigGenerator.cs:line 51
   at Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Utility.TestDriverConfigGenerator.TestGeneratingDriverConfigFileWithoutNameServer() in D:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Utility\TestDriverConfigGenerator.cs:line 88
Result Message: 
System.InvalidOperationException : Failed to extract files from jar file with stdout :and stderr:java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: MALFORMED
    at java.util.zip.ZipCoder.toString(ZipCoder.java:58)
    at java.util.zip.ZipFile.getZipEntry(ZipFile.java:567)
    at java.util.zip.ZipFile.access$900(ZipFile.java:61)
    at java.util.zip.ZipFile$ZipEntryIterator.next(ZipFile.java:525)
    at java.util.zip.ZipFile$ZipEntryIterator.nextElement(ZipFile.java:500)
    at java.util.zip.ZipFile$ZipEntryIterator.nextElement(ZipFile.java:481)
    at sun.tools.jar.Main.extract(Main.java:1008)
    at sun.tools.jar.Main.run(Main.java:305)
    at sun.tools.jar.Main.main(Main.java:1288)
```

@markusweimer I think you're switching machines between test runs and that invalidates the results. Do all reports of `StreamingRemoteManagerTest` tests not executed from this PR and other ones come from the same machine, or from different ones?
@jwang98052 I've addressed your comment, please see if the explanation makes sense for you. Thanks!

> Do all reports of `StreamingRemoteManagerTest` tests not executed from this PR and other ones come from the same machine, or from different ones?

Yes. It is a i7 based ultrabook with 2 cores with hyperthreading. The last test, where TestGeneratingDriverConfigFileWithoutNameServer` failed  was run on a 6 Core i7 with hyper threading. I can make that test pass if I run it in isolation, though.

Maybe each of us should create a kind of personal "baseline" for our .NET tests? They are all machine-dependent, so if one runs tests on master branch on one machine 10 times (from scratch each time - I know I'm asking a lot), they'll know which tests fail on that specific machine, and then when they test a PR, they can have higher levels of certainty that this PR didn't introduce new failures, just the ones specific to this machine? Otherwise, you switch machines, you switch failures, and it's very hard to distinguish ones which are caused by a PR from ones which are caused by a machine.

I know this is AppVeyor's job, and a human shouldn't do it. But with these tests being always stuck there we can't get a good picture from it yet.

And then in an ideal world we'd need to troubleshoot each failure and fix it...

> And then in an ideal world we'd need to troubleshoot each failure and fix it...

I think that is the right way forward. I am actually OK merging this PR. It fixes _one_ issue. The fact that we have others shouldn't stop us.

@tcNickolas Should we add [this MS blog post](https://blogs.microsoft.com/firehose/2015/12/17/apache-reef-backbone-of-azure-stream-analytics-and-more-achieves-major-milestone/#sm.0001auimm3k6xcogz3k2jplh106oh) and the link to [Dolphin](https://github.com/cmssnu/dolphin) as examples of REEF usage  ?

I've added the unit test and  truncated the message. The message now looks like this: 

> The class Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.ClazzA+ClazzB, Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests,  should not be defined as a NamedParameter.

Any ideas on improving its readability ?

@jwang98052 I did partial review mainly of IMRUDriver and other Network drivers you modified and left some major comments...There are some major issues and errors and the IMRU driver after modifications will not even work...Please fix those issues.

Also I have testes IMRU at the scale of 500-1000 nodes earlier and it works. Lets first test it at that scale on yarn cluster before merging this.
Looks good to me.

> Should we add this MS blog post and the link to Dolphin as examples of REEF usage ?

Maybe. However, if we add one, I'd prefer [this one](https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/machinelearning/2015/12/17/reef-graduates-to-a-top-level-apache-project/) :)
@jwang98052 I've added links to the new JIRA, please have another look. Thanks!
@markusweimer @tcNickolas what is the status of this PR? Is there anything else I should fix?
@shulmanb I think this is ready to be merged. Could you rebase, change the commit message, and update the JIRA as @anupam128 suggested? Thanks!
I will test and merge.

Yes, please add the same code to the Java side or file a JIRA such that we do this at a later time.

Other than that, this seems to solve an issue, and doesn't make other tests not pass that pass reliably in `master`.
What is this PR blocked on? I personally don't have a docker setup, so I can't test it. Is that the issue?

```
The class Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.ClazzA+ClazzB, Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests, should not be defined as a NamedParameter.
```

How about this:

```
The class Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.ClazzA+ClazzB, defined in the artifact Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests, should not be defined as a NamedParameter.
```

@jwang98052 Is this correct? Is `Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests` the name of the artifact?
LGTM as well. Now we need a volunteer to test :)
This replicates essentially the same `app.config` several times. Is there a way to just reference a single copy?
I will test and merge
Class A should be used rather than name space.
@markusweimer I have addressed your comment and pushed in the change.
I will review it
@markusweimer rebased and run all tests on local. All functional tests passed. Ran HelloReef on yarn as well. Added app.config to fix the two evaluator tests.
Maybe, but the main reason will be `Mesos on Docker` is less popular combination than `Apache Yarn on Docker`.

I'll update this PR again and ask @johnyangk and @yunseong some help.
Mesos 0.28 is already out, so I want to prove REEF on this, too.
Thank you, @markusweimer .
Sure I'll test it on my mac.
Thank you, @johnyangk . I will update in an hour. :)

Hi, @johnyangk . 
I've tested on Mesos 0.27.2 and 0.28.0. 
Since this PR contains only Docker related files (no Java/C#), you can start test this PR on your local right now.
Thank you so much for your review! :)

I got this message from running Mesos 0.27. 

```
FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 34,  Failures: 14
```

The failures are caused by `org.apache.reef.tang.exceptions.InjectionException: Could not invoke constructor: new REEFScheduler`. Because the dockerfile looks almost identical to the ones for the previous Docker versions which worked fine, I'm thinking maybe there's something wrong with my Docker installation. I'll try Mesos 0.24 and if it also doesn't work, try to re-install Docker.

Strangely, there's no such error when running Mesos 0.24. I deleted all Docker images/containers and re-tried running Mesos 0.27 and got the same failures.

Some of the errors say the root cause of the failures is:

```
Caused by: org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException(java.io.IOException): File /tmp/DriverMessagingTest/reef.tar.gz could only be replicated to 0 nodes instead of minReplication (=1).  There are 3 datanode(s) running and 3 node(s) are excluded in this operation.
```

Typing in these commands after the tests are run, it looks like HDFS datanodes somehow went down.

```
root@hnn-001-01:/reef# hdfs dfsadmin -report
Configured Capacity: 58521268224 (54.50 GB)
Present Capacity: 50066192511 (46.63 GB)
DFS Remaining: 49971904512 (46.54 GB)
DFS Used: 94287999 (89.92 MB)
DFS Used%: 0.19%
Under replicated blocks: 0
Blocks with corrupt replicas: 0
Missing blocks: 0
Missing blocks (with replication factor 1): 0

-------------------------------------------------
Dead datanodes (3):

Name: 172.17.0.3:50010 (hdn-001-02)
Hostname: hdn-001-02
Decommission Status : Normal
Configured Capacity: 19507089408 (18.17 GB)
DFS Used: 62832972 (59.92 MB)
Non DFS Used: 2786975412 (2.60 GB)
DFS Remaining: 16657281024 (15.51 GB)
DFS Used%: 0.32%
DFS Remaining%: 85.39%
Configured Cache Capacity: 0 (0 B)
Cache Used: 0 (0 B)
Cache Remaining: 0 (0 B)
Cache Used%: 100.00%
Cache Remaining%: 0.00%
Xceivers: 1
Last contact: Sat Apr 02 14:16:09 UTC 2016

... (Other two are similar to the above)
```

I'd like to read the logs of the datanodes to understand what happened to them, but am having trouble ssh-ing into their nodes.

```
root@hnn-001-01:/usr/local/hadoop/logs# cat /etc/hosts
127.0.0.1   localhost
::1 localhost ip6-localhost ip6-loopback
fe00::0 ip6-localnet
ff00::0 ip6-mcastprefix
ff02::1 ip6-allnodes
ff02::2 ip6-allrouters
172.17.0.2  hdn-001-01 hdn-001-01
172.17.0.3  hdn-001-02 hdn-001-02
172.17.0.4  hdn-001-03 hdn-001-03
172.17.0.5  hnn-001-01
root@hnn-001-01:/usr/local/hadoop/logs# ssh 172.17.0.4
ssh: connect to host 172.17.0.4 port 22: No route to host
root@hnn-001-01:/usr/local/hadoop/logs# ssh hdn-001-03 
ssh: connect to host hdn-001-03 port 22: No route to host
```

I'll investigate more tomorrow...

Hi, I've tested this PR by merging REEF-1213 on the current master branch; The Mesos integration tests pass on my local OSX machine. The problem @johnyangk is experiencing seems due to the docker configuration, not due to the change in this PR.

@dongjoon-hyun Do you have any clue about the @johnyangk's problem?

@yunseong @dongjoon-hyun Thanks for the help! This morning, the tests passed.

I reproduced the failure yesterday by trying to test 0.27 and 0.28 at the same time. Due to the container name conflict, they cannot be run at the same time and the later run ends up killing the running datanode containers of the earlier run through the following code in the script:

```
for i in {1..3} do
  docker rm -f hdn-001-0$i
done
```

I'll merge the code as the failure was simply due to my impatience.
Oh, I see. Thank you all! :)
Udpated.

I assume that the root cause is an issue with our functional test framework. I'll run a sequential test run next.
I ran this with parallelism 1. No change :(
I will test and merge.

> I ran this with parallelism 1. No change :(

To be precise: I ran this after configuring Visual Studio to do 1 parallel build and run task. Not sure whether that reliably affects the xUnit runner.

I think xUnit is not affected with this setting. Our msbuild just calls xUnit command, so I think xUnit will still use default 1 thread per CPU. 
If you really want to test this with 1 thread, you need to add `-maxthreads 1` to `lang\cs\xunit.targets` line 49 (command executed to run tests).
@shulmanb It doesn't build, since `DefaultRemoteManagerFactory` doesn't implement `IRemoteManagerFactory.GetInstance`.
@afchung Sorry about that. Somehow lost part of my fix...
@afchung Pushed the fix. Again sorry about that (ran wake tests this time)

I've tested this version of PR. 

First of all, this PR doesn't solve the original issue for me: I still get our firewall pop-ups.

Second, I get two test failures: one for file extraction from .jar (REEF-1293) and second

`Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.Functional.Group.BroadcastReduceTest.TestBroadcastAndReduceOnLocalRuntime`
`The process cannot access the file 'C:\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\reef-bridge-client-0.15.0-SNAPSHOT-shaded.jar' because it is being used by another process.`

The second one, I believe, is caused by some functional tests not added to `Collection("FunctionalTests")` (for example, `TestContextStart` is not part of collection).
@afchung Thanks Andrew.

I've addressed the comments
@tcNickolas  looks good..I will merge later today.

Should this test pass now? Otherwise, I am inclined to merge this as it reduces the number of failed tests from 3 to 1 for me.

Oh, this one is new, I've never seen it on my machine. This test is already in the collection, so the solution won't be as simple as prohibiting it to run in parallel...

I'd merge this change to fight the 2 common failures, and then wait to see whether this new failure repros for anybody else. I'll look into what could cause it tomorrow. Maybe these are all results of tests speed up I've done last week?
OK. I will merge this, then.

Wow. I just re-ran the tests in the xUnit runner in ReSharper. All of the tests above (both the ones addressed by this PR and the one that hit me) pass. However, I now have three other failed tests:
- `Org.Apache.REEF.Wake.Tests.ClockTest.TestAlarmRegistrationRaceConditions()`
- `Org.Apache.REEF.Wake.Tests.ClockTest.TestSimultaneousAlarms()`
- `Org.Apache.REEF.Wake.Tests.ClockTest.TestAlarmOrder()`

When I re-run those tests, they pass instantly. Our testing seems to be very problematic right now...

I will merge this nonetheless, as I don't see how those failures could possible be caused by the change here,
Even though JVMHeapSlack has a short name, it does not seem possible to be specified on command line. Thus, I'm closing this PR.
Yes, previously firewall popups were removed, but that was 2 weeks and a number of iterations ago :-)

Since you're touching Travis config anyways, could you please also remove the lines

```
git:
   depth: 150
```

We don't really need Travis to get history of our commits that deep (https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/customizing-the-build/#Git-Clone-Depth). I wanted to do this for a long time but never had a cause to touch the setup :-)
Sure! Thank you for review, @tcNickolas .

@tcNickolas I tried running tests before merging...ReefPoison test fails for me....Basically, I get windows error message while running that evaluator failed...Since you have IFailedEvaluator in driver, I am not sure why should I be getting this message...The driver however does contain the expected log...Is this related to REEF-1310?

@tcNickolas Have I preserved your authorship everywhere I should have ?

@markusweimer Review the [main page](https://github.com/apache/reef), please.

>  I get windows error message while running that evaluator failed

That is exactly my experience when reviewing other pull requests. A dialog box pops up that tells me that `Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator` has failed. This sometimes even happens when the test itself passes...

Markus, if u kill that box immediately test passes..if u keep them there ans do not do anything for some time they pass..Are there specific tests for which this happens. Probably those which require evaluators to fail?

I haven't identified a pattern yet. Turns out that if I run the tests from the command line, they all (seem to?) pass. Maybe that's the way forward for us: to define one way to run the tests to be the "blessed" way that we judge a PR by. It is really hard to make progress with these non-deterministic test failures.
Yes, looks good. Thank you!

Ok..lemme try running tests this way.

On Tue, Apr 5, 2016 at 8:52 AM, Markus Weimer notifications@github.com
wrote:
